_comment_.collection: number of samples in the collection
_comment_.wiki: wiki page with more details - still being discussed

Accelerometer.desc: How to handle updates from the accelerometer sensor
Accelerometer.note: There are several branches: 'ndk1' is for PlayBook 1, 'master' is for PlayBook 2 and 'next' is for BlackBerry 10

AdvancedUI.desc: Advanced Buttons, Fields and Managers for Java-based BlackBerry Smartphones
AdvancedUI.note:
More details on the functionality in this DevZone Article

Note the whitespace in the URL to the sample

Analytics(ext,bbos).desc: WebWorks Java-based Smartphone extension to quickly capture and review analytics data

Ant Build Script.desc: Build Script for WebWorks applications using Ant, with support for Linting and all WebWorks Packagers (BBOS, Tablet, BB10)

AudioControl.note: There are several branches: 'ndk1' is for PlayBook 1, 'master' is for PlayBook 2 and 'next' is for BlackBerry 10

Aura.desc: Shows how to integrate HTML5, Accelerometer and CSS3 into a grahically compelling app

Barcode(ext,pb).desc: WebWorks PlayBook extension to scan 1D or 2D barcode

Barcode(ext,bbos).desc: WebWorks Java-based Smartphone extension to scan 1D or 2D barcode

BatterySample.desc: A battery display app from a radio group and an image
BatterySample.note:
A radio group and an image are used to display and describe the different battery states.

The QML uses stackLayout

BelligerentBlocks.desc: Simple Game that uses Scoreloop, 2D graphics, Box2D, SQLite3 and other features
BelligerentBlocks.note: There are several branches: 'ndk1' is for PlayBook 1, 'master' is for PlayBook 2 and 'next' is for BlackBerry 10

BucketList.note:
How to use the MultiSelectHandler on a list.

Also shows how to load and save data from a JSON file

CalendarListener(ext,bbos).desc: WebWorks Java-based Smartphone extension to receive an Appointment Event Objet

CascadesBasicSample.desc: Demonstrates the use of signal / slot between QML and C++

CascadesCookbookCpp.desc: Cookbook of the various controls in Cascades, written using C++

CascadesCookbookQML.desc: Cookbook of the various controls in Cascades, written using QML

CascadesOpenGL.desc: Simple demonstration on how to use OpenGL in a ForeignWindow

Clipboard(ext,pb).desc: WebWorks PlayBook extension to access clipboard read/write

CowBell.note:
Basic rotation animations, AbsoluteLayout, and OpenAL sound

And, if you have never seen it, check the SNL sketch on More Cowbell

Channels.desc: How two different threads can communicate sending events through channels. Uses LocationData as example
Channels.note: There are several branches: 'ndk1' is for PlayBook 1, 'master' is for PlayBook 2 and 'next' is for BlackBerry 10

CubeRotate.desc: How to create a 3D multi-colored cube using OpenGL ES
CubeRotate.note: There are several branches: 'ndk1' is for PlayBook 1, 'master' is for PlayBook 2 and 'next' is for BlackBerry 10

Dialog.desc: How to display a dialog using the dialog service
Dialog.note: There are several branches: 'ndk1' is for PlayBook 1, 'master' is for PlayBook 2 and 'next' is for BlackBerry 10

DialogSample.desc: Display different types of dialogs: alert, prompt, login, file browsers, and also context menu. Display and retrieve data.

EmailListener(ext,bbos).desc: WebWorks Java-based Smartphone extension to receive a Event Objet when email is received

FallingBlocks.desc: Shows colored blocks falling on screen
FallingBlocks.note: There are several branches: 'ndk1' is for PlayBook 1, 'master' is for PlayBook 2 and 'next' is for BlackBerry 10

FileDownloader(ext,bbos).desc: WebWorks Java-based Smartphone extension to download files from a server

FilePicker(ext,bbos).desc: WebWorks Java-based Smartphone extension to prompt your user to browse to a file

FileUploader(ext,bbos).desc: WebWorks Java-based Smartphone extension to upload files to a server

FilteredListView.desc: How to use a custom DataModel to dynamically filter the data displayed by a ListView

FileTransfer.desc: Sample applications that demonstrate how to use the blackberry.io and blackberry.io.filetransfer APIs

FunWithSensors.desc: How to activate and listen to the sensors in the device

GeoLocation.note: There are several branches: 'ndk1' is for PlayBook 1, 'master' is for PlayBook 2 and 'next' is for BlackBerry 10

Gesture.desc: How to handle gestures on the screen
Gesture.note: There are several branches: 'ndk1' is for PlayBook 1, 'master' is for PlayBook 2 and 'next' is for BlackBerry 10

GLES11Template.desc: Template showing how to set up the BPS infrastructure and  OpenGL ES 1.1
GLES11Template.note: There are several branches: 'ndk1' is for PlayBook 1, 'master' is for PlayBook 2 and 'next' is for BlackBerry 10

GLES20Template.desc: Template showing how to set up the BPS infrastructure and  OpenGL ES 2.0
GLES20Template.note: There are several branches: 'ndk1' is for PlayBook 1, 'master' is for PlayBook 2 and 'next' is for BlackBerry 10

GlobalEvent(ext,bbos).desc: WebWorks Java-based Smartphone extension to listen for Global Events (given a GUID)

GoodCitizen.desc: Introduction to a number of common development practices
GoodCitizen.note:
Showcases lighting, textures, orientation and touch events, swipe downs, saving application state, clean termination, etc

There are several branches: 'ndk1' is for PlayBook 1, 'master' is for PlayBook 2 and 'next' is for BlackBerry 10

GoodCitizenCascades.desc: The Cascades version of the NDK Sample App named 'Good Citizen'
GoodCitizenCascades.note:
This sample features best practices on how to properly structure the Open GL code and link it with Cascades.

The sample shows how to leverage Actions and the use of NavigatorPanes for multiple panels, as well as how to process touch events and use them to control a 3D scene rendered in OpenGL, using Qt objects and JavaScript

HelloCamera.desc: Sets up a Cascades foreign window and connects a Camera Viewfinder to it
HelloCamera.note:
HelloCamera is a slender little app showing how to set up a Cascades foreign window and connect the Camera viewfinder to it.

It has functionality for starting and stopping the camera service, changing between cameras and take photos that saves to the camera album

HelloCascades.desc: Very basic Hello World in Cascades

HelloForeignWindow.desc: Introduction to using the ForeignWindow API

HelloOggVorbis.desc: Basic Ogg file handling using OpenAL and Ogg Vorbis
HelloOggVorbis.note:
This sample is extended from the original cascades cowbell sample in the Cascades-Samples repository.

The objective of this sample is to serve as a tutorial for setting up OpenAL and OggVorbis SDK to play compressed .ogg vorbis sound format. The sample also shows how to decode the regular .wav files without ALUT

HelloVideoCamera.desc: A minimalist Cascades-based video camera app
HelloVideoCamera.note:
HelloVideoCamera is a minimalist Cascades-based video camera app. It illustrates how to set up a Cascades foreign window and connect the Camera viewfinder to it.

HelloVideoCamera has functionality for starting and sotpping the camera, changing between front and back cameras, and recording video files which are saved to the camera roll.

HelloWorld.desc: Simple WebWorks application; uses Location API

HelloWorldConsole.note: There are several branches: 'ndk1' is for PlayBook 1, 'master' is for PlayBook 2 and 'next' is for BlackBerry 10

HelloWorldDataModel.desc: Use your own DataModel with ListView
HelloWorldDataModel.note: For more details, refer to the companion KB Article

HelloWorldDisplay.note: There are several branches: 'ndk1' is for PlayBook 1, 'master' is for PlayBook 2 and 'next' is for BlackBerry 10

HttpProxy.desc: Retrieve the proxy information of the device, and query a URL
HttpProxy.note: There are several branches: 'ndk1' is for PlayBook 1, 'master' is for PlayBook 2 and 'next' is for BlackBerry 10

HttpTestSample.desc: How to use HTTP Post and Get to communicate with a remote server

Internationalization.desc: How to use the built-in Internationalization engine to deliver your app in multiple languages

Invoke.desc: Two sample applications that show how to use the blackberry.invoke API for WebWorks
Invoke.note: There are two sample applications: invokable and invoker

InvokeClient.desc: A simple client to invoke target apps in the Invocation Framework
InvokeClient.note:
This app acts as a client that can invoke target apps registered with the Invocation Framework.

Easiest way to take it for a spin is to also download Invoke Target sample application

InvokeTarget1.desc: This app acts as a Target that can be invoked by InvokeClient
InvokeTarget1.note: This app acts as a Target that can be invoked by InvokeClient
InvokeTarget1.warning: There is also an 'InvokeTarget2' application. We need to clarify the relationship between the two apps

JDE-Samples.client.desc: A collection of samples included in the BlackBerry JDE.  There is one branch per JDE release

JDE-Samples.server.desc: A collection of samples included in the BlackBerry JDE.  There is one branch per JDE release
JDE-Samples.server.note: For 7.1, there are 10 'server' samples, as wel as several desktop samples

JDE-Samples.desktop.desc: A collection of samples included in the BlackBerry JDE.  There is one branch per JDE release
JDE-Samples.desktop.note: Companion to the client and server samples

Kakel.note: Some decorative and interaction elements in QML, while actual game board and logics is in C++

Keyboard.desc: How to handle key presses on the virtual keyboard
Keyboard.note: There are several branches: 'ndk1' is for PlayBook 1, 'master' is for PlayBook 2 and 'next' is for BlackBerry 10

KitchenSink.desc: Demonstrates the multitude of capabilities and functionality that can be built into a BlackBerry WebWorks APps

LED.note: Uses the LDE API, overlays images, creates custom components

LightningCrossfadeCpp.desc: Lightning Crossfade for Text and Image, usinc C++
LightningCrossfadeCpp.note:
Add images to a UI, use layouts and add a slider attached to it.

Do this in C++

LightningCrossfadeQML.desc: Lightning Crossfade for Text and Image, usinc QML
LightningCrossfadeQML.note:
Add images to a UI, use layouts and add a slider attached to it.

Do this in QML

LLCPDemo.desc: Shows how to transfer data between two NFC-enabled BlackBerry Smartphones using the NFC Logical Link Control Protocol
LLCPDemo.note:
For Java-based Smartphones. Requires BB7.1

Also see the NFC Wiki page

Loader.desc: Load and Unload Controls from the UI at runtime
Loader.note: How to use QDeclarativeComponent to extend Cascades

Locale(ext,pb).desc: WebWorks PlayBook extension to retrieve the locale string

Locale(ext,bbos).desc: WebWorks Java-based Smartphone extension to retrieve the locale string

LocaleSample.desc: How to retrieve locale information from the device
LocaleSample.note: There are several branches: 'ndk1' is for PlayBook 1, 'master' is for PlayBook 2 and 'next' is for BlackBerry 10

LocationDiagnostics.desc: Demonstrates the C++ Location APIs in Cascades
LocationDiagnostics.note: Satelite information is not yet available and neither is Map access

LocationPicker(ext,bbos).desc: WebWorks Java-based Smartphone extension to select a point on the map and get latitue and longitude

LogExceptionSample.desc: How to handle an exception, log it, and display meaningful data back to the user

MessageList(ext,bbos).desc: WebWorks Java-based Smartphone extension to add items to the main mesage list

MakeThis!.desc: An informal Post-It Kick-Starting the 'Stump The BlackBerry Dev' Program

Multithreading 101.desc: Demonstrates how four different threads can process data in a thread and update the UI independently

Multithreading 102.desc: Shows the proper method of breaking a network call into a separate class and have the interface bring back the response into the UI

NativeCamera.desc: A simple picture-taking app in C/C++ without Cascades
NativeCamera.note:
The sample shows:
  • how to access the camera
  • how to start the viewfinder and acquire the corresponding viewfinder window handle
  • how to take a photo (non-blocking)
  • how to save a photo to the camera roll
  • how to pass argument data between the main thread and your callback threads
  • how to signal your main thread using user-defined bps events from your callback thread

NetworkStatus.desc: How to retrieve the network status of the device
NetworkStatus.note: There are several branches: 'ndk1' is for PlayBook 1, 'master' is for PlayBook 2 and 'next' is for BlackBerry 10

NFC(ext,bbos).desc: WebWorks Java-based Smartphone extension to read supported NDEF record types

NfcMidlet2.desc: MIDlet that can receive HCI transaction notifications relating NFC card emulation activity
NfcMidlet2.note:
For Java-based BlackBerry Smartphones; requires BB 7.0 or above

Also see the NFC Wiki page

NfcReadNdefSmartTag.desc: Show how to receive NDEF messages from tags and how to process them
NfcReadNdefSmartTag.note:
For Java-based BlackBerry Smartphones; requires BB 7.1 or above

Also see the NFC Wiki page

NfcWriteNdefSmartTag.desc: Show how to write various sorts of NDEF messages to NFC tags
NfcWriteNdefSmartTag.note:
For Java-based BlackBerry Smartphones; requires BB 7.1 or above

Also see the NFC Wiki page

NfcVirtualTargetFun.desc: Shows the emulation and reading of NFC virtual tags
NfcVirtualTargetFun.note:
For Java-based BlackBerry Smartphones; requires BB 7.0 or above

Also see the NFC Wiki page

NfcSnepResponder.desc: Shows how to transfer NDEF messages between NFC-enabled BlackBerry smartphones using the Simple NDEF Exchange Protocol (SNEP)
NfcSnepResponder.note:
For Java-based BlackBerry Smartphones; requires BB 7.1 or above

Also see the NFC Wiki page

NfcTool.desc: Shows how to use selected BlackBerry 10 NFC APIs
NfcTool.note:
Supports:

  • Reading NDEF tags
  • Writing NDEF tags
  • Transfer vCard via SNEP

Also see the NFC Wiki page

NfcTransactionHandler.desc: Shows key aspects of an application working in NFC card emulation mode
NfcTransactionHandler.note:
For Java-based BlackBerry Smartphones; requires BB 7.1 or above

Also see the NFC Wiki page

NothingButNet.note: See recording of demo at YouTube
NothingButNet.warning:
Location of sample will change within the repository

Does not compile for R6!

Notification(ext,bbos).desc: WebWorks Java-based Smartphone extension to register your app with the custom notification and sound profile

NutritutionTracker.desc: How to make a semi-complex list with rich formatting using jQuery Mobile
NutritutionTracker.note: Samples are intended to be included in the jQuery Mobile Cookbook

OpenDataSpace-BBJava.desc: The OpenSource Edition of the java-based client for SSP Europe's SecureDataSpace
OpenDataSpace-BBJava.note:
This is a production-ready application

This project is led by SPP Europe

OpenDataSpace-Cascades.desc: The OpenSource Edition of the Cascades-based client for SSP Europe's SecureDataSpace
OpenDataSpace-Cascades.note:
This is a production-ready application

This project is led by SPP Europe

OpenGLES2-ProgrammingGuide.desc: Port of the samples from the OpenGL ES 2 Programming Guide

Payment.desc: Shows how to use the BlackBerry Payment service from a BlackBerry WebWorks App

PaymentService.desc: How to support purchase requests in your application using the Payment Service
PaymentService.note: There are several branches: 'ndk1' is for PlayBook 1, 'master' is for PlayBook 2 and 'next' is for BlackBerry 10

PaymentSample.desc: Demonstrates how to use the Payment Service APIs
PaymentSample.note: Shows how add features like a 'Buy' button and how to display purchase history and subscription terms.  Also shows several layouts and load data into a list using XmlDataModel

PeaksAndValleys.desc: Show how to navigate through a landscape using WebGL
PeaksAndValleys.note:
Sample showcases rendering, textures, lighting, skybox and terrain generation and more

This game runs on the BlackBerry PlayBook and BlackBerry 10 as well as on desktop browsers.

There is no online version yet (unlike TunnelTilt)

PhotoBomber.note: How to use the Cascades multimedia library with the Camera, take a picture, manipulate the image to be grayscale, and add an image over another image

PictureWall.desc: Control a collection of BlackBerry PlayBooks to display one or more images
PictureWall.note:
Uses socket.io on the client and nodeJS on the server

Should run on BB10

PlayAudio.desc: How to play an MP3 file
PlayAudio.note: There are several branches: 'ndk1' is for PlayBook 1, 'master' is for PlayBook 2 and 'next' is for BlackBerry 10

PlayWav.desc: How to play a WAV file
PlayWav.note: There are several branches: 'ndk1' is for PlayBook 1, 'master' is for PlayBook 2 and 'next' is for BlackBerry 10

PoemMaker.note:
The Poem Maker is a simple application with three lines of text (labels) and a button. Clicking the button will generate a random 'refrigerator' poem

Among others, the application shows how to use JavaScript functions in QML

PullMyBeard.note:
This sample application illustrates how to set up a very basic touch interaction.

This is illustrated by moving an image in response to a touch event, and animating it back to position when the touch ends

PushCapture.desc: Demonstrates how to write a BlackBerry 10 WebWorks Application that can receive push events
PushCapture.note: Consult the PushService and PushPayload classes from the API reference for useful examples and a full description of how to use the push APIs

PushSampleApp(AIR-BB10).desc: A BlackBerry 10 Adobe AIR App that can receive Push Events
PushSampleApp(AIR-BB10).note: Note that there are two branches: bb10 for BlackBerry 10 and master for PlayBook

QImageScratchPad.desc: How to use QImage and QPainter to prepare a cascades::Image
QImageScratchPad.note: For more details, refer to the companion KB Article

Quotes.note: Shows how to deal with dynamic data in a list that is stored in a SQL database

Repeater.note:
How to use QDeclarativeComponent to add a custom element

Load and unload controls from external QML file or internal component

RestaurantLocator.desc: How to make a semi-complex list with rich formatting using jQuery Mobile
RestaurantLocator.note: Samples are intended to be included in the jQuery Mobile Cookbook

SampleApplication(AIR).desc: An App that uses the Adobe AIR SDK for PlayBook and the SampleLibrary
SampleApplication(AIR).note: Note that there are two branches: bb10 for BlackBerry 10 and master for PlayBook

SampleBPSANE(ext,AIR).desc: How to create an AIR Native Extension using the BPS system
SampleBPSANE(ext,AIR).note: This extension is also currently on Samples-for-AIR but does not belong there

SampleBwsClient(C#).desc: A C# program that uses the BlackBerry Web Services (BWS) for Enterprise Administration APIs

SampleBwsClient(Java).desc: A Java program that uses the BlackBerry Web Services (BWS) for Enterprise Administration APIs

SampleLibrary(AIR).desc: Several component samples for the Adobe AIR SDK for PlayBook
SampleLibrary(AIR).note:
Note that there are two branches: bb10 for BlackBerry 10 and master for PlayBook

Samples include Navigation Menu, Search, Download Manager, Media Playbar, Screen Animations, Cache, Scrolling Margee, Back button

ScoreloopIntegrationSample.desc: Integration of Scoreloop with the BPS event system
ScoreloopIntegrationSample.note: Two variations, with Makefile and Managed by IDE, showing integration of Scoreloop with a native App

Screen(ext,bbos).desc: WebWorks Java-based Smartphone extension to subscribe to srolling events, set title and show/hide virtual keyboard

ScreenTemplate.desc: Template you can use to set your application to start using the BPS infrastructure
ScreenTemplate.note: There are several branches: 'ndk1' is for PlayBook 1, 'master' is for PlayBook 2 and 'next' is for BlackBerry 10

SendMenu(ext,bbos).desc: WebWorks Java-based Smartphone extension to expose the Send/Share Menu API

SimpleLocationAPI.desc: Simplified version of the Location API packages for the Java-based BlackBerry Smartphones
SimpleLocationAPI.note: Note the whitespace embedded in the URL!

SketchPad.desc: Shows how to use touch events and HTML5 Canvas in a BlackBerry WebWorks App

Sleep(ext,bbos).desc: WebWorks Java-based Smartphone extension to suspend and enable the backlight

Sleep(ext,pb).desc: WebWorks PlayBook extension to suspend changing the system IdleMode property

ScrollableLists.desc: A UI that scrolls horizontally in Cascades

SoapXMLSample.desc: How to access a SOAP service using QTSoap, and how to handle the XML Response

SocialApp.desc: Shows integration with Social Apps like FaceBook, Twitter, etc

SpeedWriter.note:
Shows how to create a Custom Control in C++ and add it to a QML document.

Also shows how to monitor changes in a TextField and update a TextArea

SpinnerControl(ext,bbos).desc: WebWorks Java-based Smartphone extension to allow a more usable interface with SELECT elements in browser

StampCollector.desc: List with JSON and XML data
StampCollector.note: How to create a simple list and trigger changes in the UI on selection

StarshipSettings.desc: Demonstrates how to use persistent store
StarshipSettings.note: A simple control panel using QSettings API for persistent store

StarshipSettings(AIR-BB10).desc: A port of the StarshipSettings application from Cascades to Adobe AIR
StarshipSettings(AIR-BB10).note: Note that there are two branches: bb10 for BlackBerry 10 and master for PlayBook

Storage(ext,bbos).desc: WebWorks Java-based Smartphone extension to make use of the persistent storage on the device

SwipeMenu.desc: A swipe-down menu framwork for BlacKBerry WebWorks on PlayBook

SwipeMenu.js.desc: A swipe-down menu framework for BlackBerry WebWorks
SwipeMenu.js.note: Sample application that demonstrates swipemenu.js: A swipe-down menu framework for BlackBerry WebWorks SDK

SystemLog(ext,pb).desc: WebWorks PlayBook extension to write to the BlackBerry System Event Log

SystemLog(ext,bbos).desc: WebWorks Java-based Smartphone extension to write to the BlackBerry System Event Log

TouchTicTacToe.desc: Demonstrates how to use NFC in a simple game of Tic-Tac-Toe
TouchTicTacToe.note:
For Java-based BlackBerry Smartphones; requires BB 7.1 or above

Also see the NFC Wiki page

Titlebar.desc: Titlebar API for BlackBerry OS 4.2.1 and above
Titlebar.note: Note there is a TitleBar API for BlackBerry OS 6.0 and above

TransportCoverage(ext,bbos).desc: WebWorks Java-based Smartphone extension to check availability and coverage of a specic transport

TunnelTilt.desc: Demonstrates how to use WebGL and how to package it using WebWorks
TunnelTilt.note:
A playable race-the-tunnel game that runs on the BlackBerry PlayBook and BlackBerry 10 as well as on desktop browsers.

Usually packaged into a WebWorks App but for a browser experience, visit here

TwitterTimeline.desc: Accesses the Twitter RESTful service an duses the JSON responde to display a list of tweets on screen

UIExamples.desc: Shows how to replicated some common types of BlackBerry UI concepts.  Use bbUI.js instead
UIExamples.warning: This is obsolete; use bbUI.js instead

UploadDownload(ext,pb).desc: WebWorks PlayBook extension to upload and download files from/to server

VideoPlayback.desc: How to use the multimedia capabilities of the native SDK
VideoPlayback.note: There are several branches: 'ndk1' is for PlayBook 1, 'master' is for PlayBook 2 and 'next' is for BlackBerry 10

VideoPlayerSample.desc: A simple video player application that uses the MediaPlayer API
VideoPlayerSample.note: VideoPlayerSample is a simple video player application. It uses the new MediaPlayer API and showcases all the fundamentals to make other full fledged video player applications.

VideoWindow.desc: How to use the multimedia capabilities of the native SDK in concert with OpenGL ES 2.0
VideoWindow.note: There are several branches: 'ndk1' is for PlayBook 1, 'master' is for PlayBook 2 and 'next' is for BlackBerry 10

Weather.desc: Shows how to use the HTML5 Database and the GeoLocation APIs

WeatherGuesser.desc: Uses tabbed and navigation panes and loads data from SQL and nonlocal JSON feeds
WeatherGuesser.note: Shows how to use NavigationPane and TabbedPane, and how to populate a list using GroupDataModel and JSON and SQL

WeatherGuesser(AIR-BB10).desc: A port of the WeatherGuesser application from Cascades to Adobe AIR
WeatherGuesser(AIR-BB10).note: Note that there are two branches: bb10 for BlackBerry 10 and master for PlayBook

YouTubeClient.desc: How to use the Communication API in BlackBerry 6.0 with YouTube Data API
YouTubeClient.note: Note the white space in the URL
